intro: Chamaesyce simulans, commonly known as the smallleaf sandbur, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or disturbed soils and is often found in open habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its leaves are narrow and covered with fine hairs, and it produces small, spiny burrs that aid in seed dispersal. Chamaesyce simulans is an annual plant that blooms from spring to early summer.
